Episodes.description: First, Homer uses a magic hammock to clone himself in "Send In The Clones." Then, gun-wielding zombies attack Springfield after a ban on firearms in "The Right To Creep And Scare Harms." Finally, The Simpsons are trapped on an island where people are transformed into animals in "The Island Of Dr. Hibbert."
Episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XIII

Episodes.description: When Marge, Lisa and Bart find out how hard Homer struggles to keep a roof over their heads, they enroll him in a Rock & Roll fantasy camp to relax at for a week.
Episodes.title: How I Spent My Strummer Vacation

Episodes.description: Bart and Lisa are respectively held back and moved forward one grade, putting them in the same class.
Episodes.title: Bart vs. Lisa vs. the Third Grade

Episodes.description: Marge accidentally gets breast implants.
Episodes.title: Large Marge

Episodes.description: After Lisa brings home the stick of a pro hockey player for yelling at him to shoot between the goalie's legs, the Simpsons' house is eaten by termites. To get a home, the family joins a reality show, where they must live like a family from 1895.
Episodes.title: Helter Shelter

Episodes.description: Homer has to use Sideshow Bob in order to track down a potential assassin.
Episodes.title: The Great Louse Detective

Episodes.description: After Skinner once again has let Mrs. Krabappel down, Bart takes her to the cinema. To cheer her up, Bart nominates Krabappel for the 'teacher of the year' award. The nominations is accepted, and soon the Simpsons family and Mrs. Krabappel are going to the award ceremony in Orlando, Florida, where Skinner tries to get back Krabappel by asking her to marry him.
Episodes.title: Special Edna

Episodes.description: Homer hires a private detective to learn more about Lisa.
Episodes.title: The Dad Who Knew Too Little

Episodes.description: Marge takes up body-building to boost her self-esteem after a mugging, but the family finds they just can't cope with a Marge that can bench-press 500 pounds.
Episodes.title: The Strong Arms of the Ma

Episodes.description: Homer turns to religion to help him get what he wants, and is soon awarded the church in an injury settlement. Homer then turns the church into his personal party pad, and Reverend Lovejoy leaves Springfield to wallow in its hedonism.
Episodes.title: Pray Anything

Episodes.description: When Bart finds out Homer has used all the money Bart got for doing a commercial when he was a baby, he moves out of the house and into the same building as famous skateboarder, Tony Hawk, whose skateboarding tour Bart joins.
Episodes.title: Barting Over

Episodes.description: Lisa participates in the Spellympics, but Homer is busy traveling cross-country as Krusty Burger test-markets a new sandwich. Lisa is confident that she will win, until she learns that the contest is rigged against her.
Episodes.title: I'm Spelling as Fast as I Can

Episodes.description: Ned Flanders starts dating a the famous movie star, Sara Sloane, but Ned has difficulties with the tabloids following them everywhere.
Episodes.title: A Star Is Born-Again

Episodes.description: The family makes Krusty run for Congress because of air traffic being redirected to fly dangerously close to their house.
Episodes.title: Mr. Spritz Goes to Washington

Episodes.description: Homer takes over the power plant after tricking Mr. Burns into making him the official owner of the power plant.
Episodes.title: C.E. D'oh

Episodes.description: Lisa becomes interested in astronomy and starts fighting the light pollution which is preventing her from being able to enjoy her new hobby.
Episodes.title: Scuse Me While I Miss the Sky

Episodes.description: Finding an old note, Homer discovers Marge secretly hated him many years back. Upset, he leaves the house and moves in with two gays.
Episodes.title: Three Gays of the Condo

Episodes.description: Homer's song, "Everybody Hates Ned Flanders", becomes a hit in Springfield, but the family leaves Springfield to live a couple of weeks in a ranch to escape Homer's song.
Episodes.title: Dude, Where's My Ranch?

Episodes.description: Homer throws out Santa's Little Helper for not saving him from a fire, but soon the dog becomes Duff's new mascot.
Episodes.title: Old Yeller-Belly

Episodes.description: Because of Homer losing his driver's license, Marge has to drive everyone everywhere, which is so stressful for her that she accidentally runs over Homer leading to the two seeing a marriage counselor.
Episodes.title: Brake My Wife, Please

Episodes.description: Marge makes Bart quit hanging out with Milhouse after the two are caught invading the Flanders' home. She then starts a peer group based around Native American life for Bart, Nelson, Ralph and Database to participate in. When Bart finds out Milhouse has joined a different peer group, they soon are at odds as they see whose group can do more community service around Springfield.
Episodes.title: The Bart of War

Episodes.description: After the blooming of a huge plant in Springfield's botanic gardens causes a stinking fume to spread across town, all the Springfieldians take their cars and drive away from the city. When the traffic is jammed on a bridge, Homer falls asleep. When he accelerates, he crashes into another car and Maggie is sent flying out the open roof window. In the mean time, Moe is about to commit suicide by jumping off the same bridge, which is prevented by Maggie falling into his arms. He then becomes crazily obsessed by the baby.
Episodes.title: Moe Baby Blues
